1565 /* checksum functions */
1566
1567/*
1568 These functions are not related to compression but are exported
1569 anyway because they might be useful in applications using the compression
1570 library.
1571*/
1572
1573ZEXTERN uLong ZEXPORT adler32 OF((uLong adler, const Bytef *buf, uInt len));
1574/*
1575 Update a running Adler-32 checksum with the bytes buf[0..len-1] and
1576 return the updated checksum. If buf is Z_NULL, this function returns the
1577 required initial value for the checksum.
1578
1579 An Adler-32 checksum is almost as reliable as a CRC32 but can be computed
1580 much faster.
1581
1582 Usage example:
1583
1584 uLong adler = adler32(0L, Z_NULL, 0);
1585
1586 while (read_buffer(buffer, length) != EOF) {
1587 adler = adler32(adler, buffer, length);
1588 }
1589 if (adler != original_adler) error();
1590*/
1591
1592/*
1593ZEXTERN uLong ZEXPORT adler32_combine OF((uLong adler1, uLong adler2,
1594 z_off_t len2));
1595
1596 Combine two Adler-32 checksums into one. For two sequences of bytes, seq1
1597 and seq2 with lengths len1 and len2, Adler-32 checksums were calculated for
1598 each, adler1 and adler2. adler32_combine() returns the Adler-32 checksum of
1599 seq1 and seq2 concatenated, requiring only adler1, adler2, and len2. Note
1600 that the z_off_t type (like off_t) is a signed integer. If len2 is
1601 negative, the result has no meaning or utility.
1602*/
1603
1604ZEXTERN uLong ZEXPORT crc32 OF((uLong crc, const Bytef *buf, uInt len));
1605/*
1606 Update a running CRC-32 with the bytes buf[0..len-1] and return the
1607 updated CRC-32. If buf is Z_NULL, this function returns the required
1608 initial value for the crc. Pre- and post-conditioning (one's complement) is
1609 performed within this function so it shouldn't be done by the application.
1610
1611 Usage example:
1612
1613 uLong crc = crc32(0L, Z_NULL, 0);
1614
1615 while (read_buffer(buffer, length) != EOF) {
1616 crc = crc32(crc, buffer, length);
1617 }
1618 if (crc != original_crc) error();
1619*/
1620
1621/*
1622ZEXTERN uLong ZEXPORT crc32_combine OF((uLong crc1, uLong crc2, z_off_t len2));
1623
1624 Combine two CRC-32 check values into one. For two sequences of bytes,
1625 seq1 and seq2 with lengths len1 and len2, CRC-32 check values were
1626 calculated for each, crc1 and crc2. crc32_combine() returns the CRC-32
1627 check value of seq1 and seq2 concatenated, requiring only crc1, crc2, and
1628 len2.
1629*/
1630
1631 /* various hacks, don't look :) */
1632
1633/* deflateInit and inflateInit are macros to allow checking the zlib version
1634 * and the compiler's view of z_stream:
1635 */
1636ZEXTERN int ZEXPORT deflateInit_ OF((z_streamp strm, int level,
1637 const char *version, int stream_size));
1638ZEXTERN int ZEXPORT inflateInit_ OF((z_streamp strm,
1639 const char *version, int stream_size));
1640ZEXTERN int ZEXPORT deflateInit2_ OF((z_streamp strm, int level, int method,
1641 int windowBits, int memLevel,
1642 int strategy, const char *version,
1643 int stream_size));
1644ZEXTERN int ZEXPORT inflateInit2_ OF((z_streamp strm, int windowBits,
1645 const char *version, int stream_size));
1646ZEXTERN int ZEXPORT inflateBackInit_ OF((z_streamp strm, int windowBits,
1647 unsigned char FAR *window,
1648 const char *version,
1649 int stream_size));
1650#define deflateInit(strm, level) \
1651 deflateInit_((strm), (level), ZLIB_VERSION, (int)sizeof(z_stream))
1652#define inflateInit(strm) \
1653 inflateInit_((strm), ZLIB_VERSION, (int)sizeof(z_stream))
1654#define deflateInit2(strm, level, method, windowBits, memLevel, strategy) \
1655 deflateInit2_((strm),(level),(method),(windowBits),(memLevel),\
1656 (strategy), ZLIB_VERSION, (int)sizeof(z_stream))
1657#define inflateInit2(strm, windowBits) \
1658 inflateInit2_((strm), (windowBits), ZLIB_VERSION, \
1659 (int)sizeof(z_stream))
1660#define inflateBackInit(strm, windowBits, window) \
1661 inflateBackInit_((strm), (windowBits), (window), \
1662 ZLIB_VERSION, (int)sizeof(z_stream))
1663
1664#ifndef Z_SOLO
1665
1666/* gzgetc() macro and its supporting function and exposed data structure. Note
1667 * that the real internal state is much larger than the exposed structure.
1668 * This abbreviated structure exposes just enough for the gzgetc() macro. The
1669 * user should not mess with these exposed elements, since their names or
1670 * behavior could change in the future, perhaps even capriciously. They can
1671 * only be used by the gzgetc() macro. You have been warned.
1672 */
1673struct gzFile_s {
1674 unsigned have;
1675 unsigned char *next;
1676 z_off64_t pos;
1677};
1678ZEXTERN int ZEXPORT gzgetc_ OF((gzFile file)); /* backward compatibility */
1679#ifdef Z_PREFIX_SET
1680# undef z_gzgetc
1681# define z_gzgetc(g) \
1682 ((g)->have ? ((g)->have--, (g)->pos++, *((g)->next)++) : gzgetc(g))
1683#else
1684# define gzgetc(g) \
1685 ((g)->have ? ((g)->have--, (g)->pos++, *((g)->next)++) : gzgetc(g))
1686#endif
1687
1688/* provide 64-bit offset functions if _LARGEFILE64_SOURCE defined, and/or
1689 * change the regular functions to 64 bits if _FILE_OFFSET_BITS is 64 (if
1690 * both are true, the application gets the *64 functions, and the regular
1691 * functions are changed to 64 bits) -- in case these are set on systems
1692 * without large file support, _LFS64_LARGEFILE must also be true
1693 */
1694#ifdef Z_LARGE64
1695 ZEXTERN gzFile ZEXPORT gzopen64 OF((const char *, const char *));
1696 ZEXTERN z_off64_t ZEXPORT gzseek64 OF((gzFile, z_off64_t, int));
1697 ZEXTERN z_off64_t ZEXPORT gztell64 OF((gzFile));
1698 ZEXTERN z_off64_t ZEXPORT gzoffset64 OF((gzFile));
1699 ZEXTERN uLong ZEXPORT adler32_combine64 OF((uLong, uLong, z_off64_t));
1700 ZEXTERN uLong ZEXPORT crc32_combine64 OF((uLong, uLong, z_off64_t));
1701#endif
1702
1703#if !defined(ZLIB_INTERNAL) && defined(Z_WANT64)
1704# ifdef Z_PREFIX_SET
1705# define z_gzopen z_gzopen64
1706# define z_gzseek z_gzseek64
1707# define z_gztell z_gztell64
1708# define z_gzoffset z_gzoffset64

1710# define z_crc32_combine z_crc32_combine64
1711# else
1712# define gzopen gzopen64
1713# define gzseek gzseek64
1714# define gztell gztell64
1715# define gzoffset gzoffset64
1716# define adler32_combine adler32_combine64
1717# define crc32_combine crc32_combine64
1718# endif
1719# ifndef Z_LARGE64
1720 ZEXTERN gzFile ZEXPORT gzopen64 OF((const char *, const char *));
1721 ZEXTERN z_off_t ZEXPORT gzseek64 OF((gzFile, z_off_t, int));
1722 ZEXTERN z_off_t ZEXPORT gztell64 OF((gzFile));
1723 ZEXTERN z_off_t ZEXPORT gzoffset64 OF((gzFile));
1724 ZEXTERN uLong ZEXPORT adler32_combine64 OF((uLong, uLong, z_off_t));
1725 ZEXTERN uLong ZEXPORT crc32_combine64 OF((uLong, uLong, z_off_t));
1726# endif
1727#else
1728 ZEXTERN gzFile ZEXPORT gzopen OF((const char *, const char *));
1729 ZEXTERN z_off_t ZEXPORT gzseek OF((gzFile, z_off_t, int));
1730 ZEXTERN z_off_t ZEXPORT gztell OF((gzFile));
1731 ZEXTERN z_off_t ZEXPORT gzoffset OF((gzFile));

1734#endif

1739 ZEXTERN uLong ZEXPORT crc32_combine OF((uLong, uLong, z_off_t));

1741#endif /* !Z_SOLO */
